description: Returns session information for a specified bot, alias, and user ID.

parameters.name: botName
parameters.description: The name of the bot that contains the session data.

parameters.name: botAlias
parameters.description: The alias in use for the bot that contains the session data.

parameters.name: userId
parameters.description: The ID of the client application user. Amazon Lex uses this to identify a user's conversation with your bot.

parameters.name: checkpointLabelFilter
parameters.description: A string used to filter the intents returned in the recentIntentSummaryView structure. When you specify a filter, only intents with their checkpointLabel field set to that string are returned.

nested_items.name: recentIntentSummaryView
nested_items.description: An array of information about the intents used in the session. The array can contain a maximum of three summaries. If more than three intents are used in the session, the recentIntentSummaryView operation contains information about the last three intents used.

nested_items.name: intentName
nested_items.description: The name of the intent.

nested_items.name: checkpointLabel
nested_items.description: A user-defined label that identifies a particular intent. You can use this label to return to a previous intent.
(string) ---
(string) ---

nested_items.name: confirmationStatus
nested_items.description: The status of the intent after the user responds to the confirmation prompt. If the user confirms the intent, Amazon Lex sets this field to Confirmed. If the user denies the intent, Amazon Lex sets this value to Denied. The possible values are:
Confirmed - The user has responded 'Yes' to the confirmation prompt, confirming that the intent is complete and that it is ready to be fulfilled.
Denied - The user has responded 'No' to the confirmation prompt.
None - The user has never been prompted for confirmation; or, the user was prompted but did not confirm or deny the prompt.

nested_items.name: dialogActionType
nested_items.description: The next action that the bot should take in its interaction with the user. The possible values are:
ConfirmIntent - The next action is asking the user if the intent is complete and ready to be fulfilled. This is a yes/no question such as 'Place the order?'
Close - Indicates that the there will not be a response from the user. For example, the statement 'Your order has been placed' does not require a response.
ElicitIntent - The next action is to determine the intent that the user wants to fulfill.
ElicitSlot - The next action is to elicit a slot value from the user.

nested_items.name: fulfillmentState
nested_items.description: The fulfillment state of the intent. The possible values are:
Failed - The Lambda function associated with the intent failed to fulfill the intent.
Fulfilled - The intent has fulfilled by the Lambda function associated with the intent.
ReadyForFulfillment - All of the information necessary for the intent is present and the intent ready to be fulfilled by the client application.

nested_items.name: slotToElicit
nested_items.description: The next slot to elicit from the user. If there is not slot to elicit, the field is blank.

nested_items.name: sessionAttributes
nested_items.description: Map of key/value pairs representing the session-specific context information. It contains application information passed between Amazon Lex and a client application.
(string) ---
(string) ---

nested_items.name: sessionId
nested_items.description: A unique identifier for the session.

nested_items.name: dialogAction
nested_items.description: Describes the current state of the bot.

nested_items.name: type
nested_items.description: The next action that the bot should take in its interaction with the user. The possible values are:
ConfirmIntent - The next action is asking the user if the intent is complete and ready to be fulfilled. This is a yes/no question such as 'Place the order?'
Close - Indicates that the there will not be a response from the user. For example, the statement 'Your order has been placed' does not require a response.
Delegate - The next action is determined by Amazon Lex.
ElicitIntent - The next action is to determine the intent that the user wants to fulfill.
ElicitSlot - The next action is to elicit a slot value from the user.

nested_items.name: intentName
nested_items.description: The name of the intent.
(string) ---
(string) ---

nested_items.name: slotToElicit
nested_items.description: The name of the slot that should be elicited from the user.

nested_items.name: fulfillmentState
nested_items.description: The fulfillment state of the intent. The possible values are:
Failed - The Lambda function associated with the intent failed to fulfill the intent.
Fulfilled - The intent has fulfilled by the Lambda function associated with the intent.
ReadyForFulfillment - All of the information necessary for the intent is present and the intent ready to be fulfilled by the client application.

nested_items.name: message
nested_items.description: The message that should be shown to the user. If you don't specify a message, Amazon Lex will use the message configured for the intent.

nested_items.name: messageFormat
nested_items.description: PlainText - The message contains plain UTF-8 text.
PlainText - The message contains plain UTF-8 text.
CustomPayload - The message is a custom format for the client.
SSML - The message contains text formatted for voice output.
Composite - The message contains an escaped JSON object containing one or more messages. For more information, see Message Groups.

nested_items.name: activeContexts
nested_items.description: A list of active contexts for the session. A context can be set when an intent is fulfilled or by calling the PostContent, PostText, or PutSession operation.

nested_items.name: name
nested_items.description: The name of the context.

nested_items.name: timeToLive
nested_items.description: The length of time or number of turns that a context remains active.

nested_items.name: timeToLiveInSeconds
nested_items.description: The number of seconds that the context should be active after it is first sent in a PostContent or PostText response. You can set the value between 5 and 86,400 seconds (24 hours).

nested_items.name: turnsToLive
nested_items.description: The number of conversation turns that the context should be active. A conversation turn is one PostContent or PostText request and the corresponding response from Amazon Lex.

nested_items.name: parameters
nested_items.description: State variables for the current context. You can use these values as default values for slots in subsequent events.
(string) ---
(string) ---
